overview_of_class: The European Union (EU) is unique in world history. Never before have 28 sovereign states cooperated more intensely on political, economic, social, judicial and security affairs than is currently the case under the European Union umbrella. This course examines how this "multi-state" entity operates in international affairs. What are the power assets of the European Union? How do EU member states cooperate in economic affairs? How do they project power in security affairs? How does the EU fight ISIS, prevent nuclear proliferation in Iran and deal with the conflict in Ukraine? How does it cooperate with the United States? Is this cooperation successful?
name: European Union in International Affairs
title: WCAS POLI_SCI 346-0-20 European Union in International Affairs
